translated: The One Hundred and One Groups

original: Vuttañhetaṁ bhagavatā vuttamarahatāti me sutaṁ:🔽“Nāhaṁ, bhikkhave, aññaṁ ekasaṁyojanampi samanupassāmi yena saṁyojanena saṁyuttā sattā dīgharattaṁ sandhāvanti saṁsaranti yathayidaṁ, bhikkhave, taṇhāsaṁyojanaṁ.
analyzed: vuttam ha etam bhagavatā vuttam arahatā iti me suta  na aha bhikkhave aññam eka sayojanam pi samanupassāmi yena sayojanena sayuttāḥ sattāḥ dīgharattam sandhāvanti sasaranti bhikkhave taṇhā sayojana
translated: This was said by the Blessed One, said by the Arahant, so I have heard:🔽“Monks, I do not see even one other fetter by which people are so fettered as they are by the fetter of craving.

original: Taṇhāsaṁyojanena hi, bhikkhave, saṁyuttā sattā dīgharattaṁ sandhāvanti saṁsarantī”ti.
analyzed: taṇhā sayojanena hi bhikkhave sayuttāḥ sattāḥ dīgharattam sandhāvanti sasaranti iti
translated: Fettered by the fetter of craving, beings are not freed from birth, aging, and death; from sorrow, lamentation, pain, displeasure, and despair; not freed from stress, I say.
And in reference to this, it was said:

analyzed: dīghamaddhāna sasara  ittha bhāva ñathā bhāva
translated: wandering a long time,🔽does not transcend existence,
the state of this being and that being.

analyzed: taṇham dukkhassa sambhava  vīta taṇhaḥ an ādānaḥ
translated: craving, the source of stress,🔽the monk, free from craving, unattached,

original: Ayampi attho vutto bhagavatā, iti me sutanti.
analyzed: ayam pi atthaḥ vuttaḥ bhagavatā iti me sutam ti
translated: This is the meaning of what the Blessed One said. So it was heard by me.
